abstracts.cdata!:
The credit will support wide ranging
            policy and institutional reforms in the financial sector.
            The policy reforms include interest rate liberalization,
            more active use of generalized monetary policy instruments
            and reductions in the fiscal deficit. It also includes the
            revision of banking legislation, improved prudential
            supervision of the banking industry and a strengthening of
            the regulatory and incentive framework for capital markets
            development. The institutional reforms include the
            restructuring of troubled banks and "near bank"
            financial institutions as well as a strengthening of the
            Central Bank's capacity to supervise despository
            institutions. The institutional restructuring component will
            aid in recapitalizing financial institutions and
            compensating insured depositors and will be released only as
            action programs are agreed with IDA and implemented by the
            Deposit Protection Fund. The funds from the credit will
            finance general imports based on a negative list.
